page.title: 01Norden Village
page.content: Norden is a western suburb of Rochdale built along the main route from Rochdale to Blackburn and Bury. The first homes grew round textile mills situated in the valleys with their plentiful supplies of water for power and processing, and were built from locally quarried stone. When mills turned to steam power Norden still provided a good site because of nearby coal deposits. Today Norden, Cutgate and Lanehead are largely residential. They are in attracive surroundings close to open countryside and are commuter areas for people working in Rochdale, Manchester and surrounding towns. There are good facilities such as a post office, library, pubs, shops and bus services.
